title: font-weight
description: The `font-weight` CSS property specifies the boldness of the font used for text content within an element.
content: The property that sets the thickness or boldness of the text. It ranges from '100' (thin) to '900' (extra bold) and can also use keywords like 'normal', 'bold', 'bolder' or 'lighter'. This property helps to emphasize certain text by making it visually heavier.
